intro: Anthospermum hirsutum, commonly known as the hairy anthospermum, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
